description: Returns the list of bundles that are available in Amazon Lightsail. A bundle describes the performance specifications for a database. You can use a bundle ID to create a new database with explicit performance specifications.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: The token to advance to the next page of results from your request. To get a page token, perform an initial GetRelationalDatabaseBundles request. If your results are paginated, the response will return a next page token that you can specify as the page token in a subsequent request.

nested_items.name: bundles
nested_items.description: An object describing the result of your get relational database bundles request.

nested_items.name: bundleId
nested_items.description: The ID for the database bundle.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name for the database bundle.

nested_items.name: price
nested_items.description: The cost of the database bundle in US currency.

nested_items.name: ramSizeInGb
nested_items.description: The amount of RAM in GB (for example, 2.0) for the database bundle.

nested_items.name: diskSizeInGb
nested_items.description: The size of the disk for the database bundle.

nested_items.name: transferPerMonthInGb
nested_items.description: The data transfer rate per month in GB for the database bundle.

nested_items.name: cpuCount
nested_items.description: The number of virtual CPUs (vCPUs) for the database bundle.

nested_items.name: isEncrypted
nested_items.description: A Boolean value indicating whether the database bundle is encrypted.

nested_items.name: isActive
nested_items.description: A Boolean value indicating whether the database bundle is active.

nested_items.name: nextPageToken
nested_items.description: The token to advance to the next page of results from your request.
